tab_list.txt: The US CMA Exams are administered by IMA, the world’s largest management accounting body. IMA offers membership to all the aspirants who successfully clear 2 CMA exams.
12th in India (Associate degree outside India) is required to appear for the US CMA exams.
Graduation is required to be eligible for a CMA credential.
Aspirants pursuing Graduation are also eligible for US CMA Credential.
The US CMA examination pattern consists of multiple-choice questions (MCQs) as well as essay-type questions.
Part 1 and Part 2 are four-hour tests containing about 100 MCQs and two essay questions.
75% of the examination consists of MCQs (multiple choice questions).
25% of the examination consists of essay questions.
The US CMA exams are graded for 500 points, and an aspirant must score a minimum of 360 to qualify for the exams. Both parts follow the same pattern.

Online exam simulation closely resembles the actual exam allowing the candidate to get equipped to the exam format. Mock exams to give hands-on experience with CMA certification.

Topic Wise study material in the form of Presentation and Case Studies. Quiz/Assignment with detailed answers and explanation

Depending on the aspirant’s plan and study schedule, the US CMA certificate can be completed in a minimum of 6 months to 3 years. As per the guidelines of IMA, an aspirant must complete the exams within 3 years from the date of registration.
Master's degree (or equivalent)
Bachelor's degree (or equivalent)
Associate degree, three A-level certificates with a grade of C or higher, (or equivalent)
12 months of internal audit experience or equivalent
24 months of internal audit experience or equivalent
60 months of internal audit experience or equivalent
Move from Traditional based audit to more analytical and technology-based audit making internal auditor function go up substantially.
Internal auditors are expected to provide recommendations for improvement in areas where deficiencies are identified.
Rising demand for investigations and process improvements.
Critical role in protecting the organisation value and business partnering.
Foundations of Internal Auditing, Governance and Risk Management
Proficiency and Due Professional Care and Fraud Risks
Managing the Internal Audit Activity and Planning the Engagement
Performing and Communicating Engagement, Monitoring Progress
Business Acumen and Information Security
Information Technology and Financial Management

ifrsPage.para: If you are a professional accountant or auditor who works in a practice or business, and are qualified according to national accounting standards, then you are eligible to take this ACCA financial reporting qualification.If you are a working professional, but not yet qualified, then you may still be eligible. You will need to prove that you have one of the following:

tab_lists.para: If you are a professional accountant or auditor who works in a practice or business, and are qualified according to national accounting standards, then you are eligible to take this ACCA financial reporting qualification.If you are a working professional, but not yet qualified, then you may still be eligible. You will need to prove that you have one of the following:

tab_list.txt: Three years of relevant accounting experience (dulyfill={true} sizes='100vw' ed, signed and stamped ACCA experience form by the employer)
A relevant degree, with two years of work experience
An ACCA certificate in International Financial Reporting, in addition to two years of work experience
BDO India and Simandhar Education in India's certificate of participation shall be awarded to all students enrolling and recording a 90 per cent attendance in the sessions.
The DipIFR is assessed by a single written exam.
This is held twice a year – in June and December at ACCA’s exam centres.
The passmark is 50%.The exam last 3 hours 15 minutes and is made up of four 25-mark compulsory questions requiring both numerical and narrative answers.
The programme fee (exclusive of GST) is INR 29,500 which includes necessary study material but excludes the exam registration fees payable to ACCA for the DipIFR exam.
Successful candidates are awarded the ‘Diploma IFRS’ qualification by ACCA.
